roleset.name: say
roleset.note: ADD-V NOTES: Member of Vncls say-37.7-1. (from add.01-v)

example.name: add-v: transitive
example.text: But he adds, "I feel pressured, disappointed, uncomfortable, and angry."
example.arg: "I feel pressured, disappointed, uncomfortable, and angry."

example.name: add-v: fronted
example.text: [That got hard to take]-1, he added *trace*-1.

example.name: add-v: inverted
example.text: [The IRS is investigating lawyers]-2, added *trace*-2 Mr. Sonnett.

example.name: add-v: split
example.text: [The bids, [he added *trace*-3]-PRN, were contrary to common sense]-3.

roleset.name: mathematics, mixing, add something to something else, increase
roleset.note: ADD-V NOTES: Member of Vncls mix-22.1-2, multiply-108 (from add.02-v)

ADDITION-N NOTES: Roleset based on PB verb entries add.02 and add.03, (distinction seems unecessary in the case of eventive noun), OntoNotes grouping addition-n senses 1, 2, 3, 5, 6; maps to VN classes multiply-108, mix-22.1-2. Framed by Claire. (from addition.01-n)

example.name: add-v: one and one makes...
example.text: Judge Curry added an additional $55 million to the commission's calculations.

example.name: add-v: merged
example.text: It also asks [them]-1 *trace*-1 to add two-sevenths and three-sevenths.

example.name: add-v: attach
example.text: Added [*]-2 to this is *T* [the perennial problem of class sizes being too large]-2.

example.name: add-v: All args
example.text: Egyptians didn't have multiplication as we know it; if you wanted to multiply 13 by 5, you added 13 to itself to get 26, then added 26 again to get 52, then added ...
example.arg: if you wanted to multiply 13 by 5

example.name: addition-n: Args 1, 2
example.text: Bankers Trust New York Corp. became the latest major U.S. bank toincrease reserves for its loans to less-developed countries ,making a $ 1.6 billion third-quarter addition to its provision .

example.name: addition-n: NP only, args 1, 2
example.text: a $ 42.7 million addition to loan-loss reserves

example.name: addition-n: Args 1 and 2, new syntax
example.text: The addition of saffron to the rice makes a lovely flavor.

example.name: addition-n: Args 0, 1
example.text: Her additions of color accents and lighting made the room seem more inviting.

example.name: addition-n: Arg 2/ original only
example.text: There has been no addition to gasoline prices this month.

example.name: addition-n: Args 1 & 2
example.text: The town was concerned about measurable additions of heavy metals into the drinking water.

roleset.name: achieve or gain
roleset.note: ADD-V NOTES: No VN class. The crucial difference between this usage and the mathematics usage is that the 'to' phrase is the end product, not the other operand. (from add.03-v)

role.descr: Logical subject, patient, thing rising/gaining/being added to

example.name: add-v: rise
example.text: The Nasdaq composite index added 1.01 to 456.6 on paltry volume.

example.name: add_up-v: it all adds up
example.text: It all adds up to a barrier to American-style index arbitrage, the most popular form of U.S. program trading that seeks to exploit brief differences between prices of stocks in New York and the price of a futures contract in Chicago based on those stocks.
example.arg: to a barrier to American-style index arbitrage, the most popular form of U.S. program trading that seeks to exploit brief differences between prices of stocks in New York and the price of a futures contract in Chicago based on those stocks

example.name: add_up-v
example.text: *PRO* add up all the people in this group and they may number 200 , and that is already a lot of people .
example.arg: all the people in this group

example.name: add-on-v: Construction
example.text: Their house was a centuries-old Colonial which-1 they had added on to*T*-1.
